page.title: 02The Landscape
page.content: The area is under lain by clays and sandstones of the Coal Measure Series with several important coal seems that have been worked in the past.In square 3814 there are remains of shafts that were worked in the 16 and 17 centuries.During W.W.2 vast open casting took place in squares 3713 and 3813.This ground has now been restored to agriculture. The land is mostly west facing. The highest point is Breach Hill(378154) at 147m a.s.l.Several very small streams drain into the Gilwiskaw Brook which eventually joins the Trent via the R. Mease and the R.Tame. There is very little woodland left except in squares 3814 and 3814.
